meta.description: No1 Lounges, Heathrow Terminal 3 at London Heathrow Airport (LHR), Terminal 3. Learn more about the lounge: amenities, photos, review, opening hours, location.

lounge.name: No1 Lounges, Heathrow Terminal 3

location.terminalDirections: Follow the signs to 'Lounge F' towards Gates 13-22, proceed up one level via the lift or stairs.

lounge.description: The perfect airport escape awaits. Travelling for work? Enjoy peace, quiet, and a quick, reliable Wi-Fi connection. Leisure? No problem. Kick-start your holiday in a comfortable and quiet oasis offering an excellent selection of food and beverages away from the hustle and bustle.

general: Shower facilities (currently unavailable) are available for ¬£10 - payable at the front desk.
Children under 2 years old are admitted free with an adult.
warning: Showers, spa services, and bedrooms are temporarily unavailable.
regulatory: This lounge is accessible to passengers departing from Terminal 3 only.
Lounge access is granted ONLY up to 3 hours prior to passenger flight departure time. Please DO NOT make a booking more than 3 hours prior to your scheduled departure time.

reviews.content: Booked 3 hr prime time thru website. Small buffet food selection. Hot food ordered at bar came out cold but OK. Spacious seats, quiet areas, very clean. Room to spread out. Plenty of work stations.
No too busy but also not all areas open so can't get really comfortable.
Greater by Shelley, had a massage & if you're at Heathrow stop in and see Shelley, he‚Äôs prob a manager.
Extremely inattentive staff at check in. Also note that if you are a Priority Pass member through credit card, you are unlikely to be allowed in.
This place fills up fast. I was lucky to find a seat. It‚Äôs the Delta lounge for terminal 3. I was looking for Delta but it‚Äôs just a partner lounge that you gain access to with Delta status.
Decent food, a la carte and plenty of drinks.
It‚Äôs really good. Comfy, cozy, clean, plenty of space, but too crowded at rush hour. A la carte is pretty okay. The only bad thing is too cold - they should turn the fans down.
Requires reservation with no clear method of doing so.
Tried to enter with Priority Pass. Was told that we would need to have pre-booked. There was clearly plenty of space in the lounge.
I was refused access on my Priority Pass and told I should have reserved a spot in the lounge five hours ahead. When I asked for future reference how I make a reservation, I was told ‚Äúgoogle it‚Äù.
Hostile, disorganized customer service. Server wandering about shouting the names of ordered food from the menu, louder and more agitated each time.
Tried this lounge for the 1st time using my Dragonpass from NatWest. Comfortable enough, but crowded and messy. Food crumbs all over the carpets. Food selection very limited. Staff friendly though.

There‚Äôs a full bar and an area with snacks, espresso machine etc. The layout is nice since there are tables for laptops/charging. Separate little rooms for extra quiet. Even a small cinema available.
Not great. A la carte menu limited to specialty items (chili, curry - no pasta, chicken or beef). Lunch buffet more limited.  Crowded and not airy. Lacking outlets near seats. Decent drink options.
Lots of space, nice food, good furniture.
Decent showers, good breakfast, ample seating (at 6:00 am). But was it worth ¬£40? I‚Äôm not too sure.
It‚Äôs a good lounge. There are different arrangement for sitting to satisfy everyone. You may struggle to get in at peak times. The food is vegetarian and child friendly, the bar is well stocked up.
One meal choice out of 5-6 items. Really a snack.  Small salad bar just ok. Seating is comfortable and lots of options. Place was clean. Slow line to get in - one checkin person. Not worth ¬£30-40.

One meal choice per pax, order at bartender, there‚Äôs a small salad buffet. Drink of your choice except champagne chargeable. Spacious lounge and many ‚Äúrooms‚Äù and different sitting to choose from. 5üåü
Very crowded at 9:30am. Understaffed to the point that the queue to get stretched outside the doors and into the hall. Wait for hot food was long too. To be fair, food and drink were good.
Early morning flight 8am on Sunday. Relatively busy in lounge. I don‚Äôt know when they changed, but now you can only order one hot food item off the menu as opposed to a buffet...
Has a variety of services not usually available - library, cinema. Not a big fan of having to order hot food off a menu with a bartender and wait a while. I prefer a buffet to grab my food and relax.
Much better than I expected. Small but nice selection of hot and cold foods, lots of seating options and areas to work or relax.

Great little lounge if you don‚Äôt have status or C/F class tickets. Small food selection, choice of 5 items, limit 1 order/visitor. Decent bar. Wouldn‚Äôt pay ¬£40 but it was free with Priority Pass.
Limited hot food selection, cold entrees were good. Not busy late morning.
NOT worth booking at all! Do not waste your money going here!! You are only allowed one small meal only. VERY crowded but pleasant staff on reception. WILL NOT BE GOING BACK.
Really not worth the money. Poor selection of food. Cinema room is nice but freezing cold & staff are not able to adjust the temperature. Limited waiting service so you have to order at the bar.
Lounge was comfortable and staff friendly.  We stopped off before an early flight, plenty of fruit and cereal but hot food limited - and restricted to one item per person, unless you pay extra.
Overall a good lounge. Although was busy! I found it didn‚Äôt have any good quiet spots as the library was being hogged by a large family. The food and drink selection was good. Bathrooms were clean.
Nice lounge but with several cut offs in the last months. Less food available, and showers no longer free (10¬£ cost).
Hard to say which one of the Priority Pass lounges is better. This lounge has order in service and a cinema quiet room which was a great touch. Both lounges are definitely worth the detour.

Nice lounge, shower included. Complimentary buffet and some meals made to order, tasty. Spa services have fair rates. A little crowded but is fine. They have both British and European electric outlets!
Great selection of included made to order hot entrees, as well as cold food bar. All alcohol is complimentary except Champagne. Two local draft beers, plus another 5-6 bottled, including one cider.
Hot, noisy and overcrowded. All the quiet areas blocked off. Staff were friendly but it was not a relaxing experience.
Nice lounge. Everything is complimentary but champagne. Hot food to order was decent. Beautiful private rooms and theater. On demand spa services. Glad I took the pit stop.
Hot food to order. Decent cold food options. Nice bar. Cozy space with a theatre and spa.
One of the best lounges I've stayed in, excellent hot food and snack (and drink) selection. Fantastic showers and comfy seats. Good magazine selection too. Highly recommended.
A nice and quiet hideaway from the busy terminal. Great selection of food, from the buffet or made to order (free of charge). Wifi is reliable too which is perfect for work.
The nicest staff & quiet in T3.
Beautiful lounge, much more civilized than the Admirals Club. Outstanding Indian food buffet spread at lunch time.
Was here over breakfast. Very busy but nice lounge. Tried the massage but had to leave early due to flight. Poor timing on my part.
Phenomenal staff, ambiance, spa and accommodations - this will be my go to destination whenever traveling through T3.

Very bad place! Impolite people in the receptionary didn't allow me to go in with the excuse they were "full" and not taking people with credit card access, while a lot of other would go in. Never return.
Plenty of charging stations. People tend to take a complete couch to themselves, or two with families. Food is okay, beer and wine, coffee and juice. A bit pricey in the end for 3 hours.
Used lounge multiple times with Diners card. After discussion with a senior staff member, turned away as they were "full" although still accepting other people in the queue. Policy not advertised.
Really enjoyed the ambiance, decoration, comfort, the fact that it has spa and private rooms. Food is okay. Such a treat for a nice layover time.
I was hoping to find some peace and comfort in No1 Lounge, because Terminal 3 is always crowded, but the lounge was incredibly crowded as well. The lounge is too small for such a busy terminal.
Drink is fine. Seats are comfortable. Not much selection for food.
Very impressed by the lounge. Premium food selection is very good and breakfast had a good selection of pastries, tea and coffee, fruit and drinks.
Nice lounge. Food could be more filling but great overall setup 4/4.
Nice place to relax and enjoy a drink or two, very stylish with comfortable chairs. A bit on the small side however, and may get very crowded.
All spirits, beers and wines were free, good quality food. Slightly busy, but plenty of space to spread out.
Great little place to escape the masses, very peaceful and good facilities. Worth the money if you're here for a few hours and in a drinking mood.
Limited selection of food, but very nice food indeed. Have a lot of options to relax - go to the snug in the bag if you want to lie down. Beverages has a wide variety.
Nice area away from the bustle of T3. Good service & staff. Buffet food is still not covered by sneeze guards & with sneezing around I did not again partake, but a good menu of delivered dishes.
Reasonable selection of food, including 1 hot snack included in entry. Service was good at the bar and the seating etc was very comfortable. Slightly busy,  but great experience overall.
Would be nice without kids running around.
Very good service and interiors. Steep price tag, but worth it when they have enough capacity to let Priority Pass in. Nice food too.
Best food, full bar and game room.
A very nice experience. Staff all very friendly and attentive. A little noisy depending on who else is there. Showers excellent. Only ¬£30 when you pay online and ¬£23.50 if with Virgin Flying Club.
Lovely calm lounge with good snacks and drinks. Staff very friendly. Too many of the additional rooms, three in all including the library were reserved with no one in them.
Excellent setup with good food and drink options. Only downside is that it can be very busy at peak times, with all the comfy sofas and chairs filled up.
i cant see the top most review
Easily one of the best Priority Pass offerings. Nice food and drinks with comfortable seating.
Flying economy so decided to cash in a Virgin frequent flyer perk for cheap entry to this lounge. Still a comfortable and quiet escape from the main airport, but service is somewhat lacking today.
This lounge was pretty fracking great. Roomy, good food, excellent spa (killer massage), nice view, zippy Internet, nice staff. Best lounge of all the Priority Pass lounges I've been to.
One of the best easy access lounges. However, it can get very busy. Good selection of snacks. You need to pay for the meals & they are expensive for tiny portions & poor quality.
Not very large and it was crowded. There are some sandwiches for free and some options to buy. Comfortable sofas, if you can find space. Very good service and spa for a fee. Soup and salad bar good!

Probably the best lounge I've been to for young kids. Food always been good, and plenty of space with different rooms for different purposes (eg snug, cinema room, kids room, etc). Lounges done right.
It was worth it to unwind in this lounge for a 7-hour layover. The cinema is a great feature to kick back a few movies and pops.
Has all the facilities and more. Excellent food.
A good lounge. Freshly prepared food as well as buffet. Many different areas and good views. Can get busy.
Excellent. Modern with a little bit of quirkiness thrown in. Food lovely and freshly prepared. Furniture quality.
One of the nicest lounges I have seen. Possibility to order (free) food from the menu is also very nice bonus.
While quite busy it's spread out enough to have a bit of room. Nice view of the runway as well.
This is a very nice lounge with a stocked bar, and good snacks. The library area looked nice, but was reserved. The games room is pretty unique.
This is an excellent lounge that offer great food, spa services (i.e. manicures, pedicures, etc). The service is also terrific. I thoroughly recommend this lounge!
This is a pretty fantastic lounge despite the optional extra charge features. This is easily the best easy access lounge in LHR.
Top-notch design, good food and drinks.  Feels like a high-end W Hotel in an airport.  Game room, kids rooms, private sleeping rooms, and cinema make this a fantastic independent lounge.

location.terminalDirections: Departure Level, after Duty Free, Lounge Area H
Exit to the right after the Terminal 3 Customs Hall, take the stairs or lift to Level 2.

otherLounges.name: American Airlines International First Class Lounge

location.terminalDirections: After Passport Control, exit Duty Free Area and turn right toward Lounge Area H.
Zone F, located along the corridor leading to Gates 13-22.
Zone F, located along the corridor leading to Gates 13-22
Lounge C in the Central Concourse, near Gate 11.
Lounge C in the Central Concourse, near Gate 11.
Located near Gate 9, lounge is signposted as "Lounge D" on the right hand side.

The Lounge is in Terminal 3 Area A. After you go through security, follow Flight Connection route Area A,  access point in the main shopping and dining area to Level 2 accessible by taking the elevators.
Zone E, Level 1, along corridor with Gates 1-11
Zone B, located in the Central Concourse, near Gate 11, next to the Cathay Pacific Lounge.
Located in the Upper Class Wing.
5 minute walk from customs, just off the Arrivals Hall
